page.title: 08Heapham Windmill.
page.content: One morning we went to visit Heapham Windmill and talk to its owner Mr. Hewitt. His family has been connected with milling for a long time. The first mill on the site was blown down in a gale. In 1873 they built a new windmill. In 1956 this was struck by lightning and all four sails came of at once. The mill is built from bricks and covered in tar to stop the rain getting in. We saw some old millstones. They were made from flint and millstone grit. They are round and flat and they have lines carved into them. There are different patterns for different types of milling. One of them had a big line that goes to the middle and two smaller ones. Then we went into a big shed where there was a diesel engine. It was made in 1933 in Lincoln by Rustons. It was used to drive a mill for rolling oats.
